data.title: Infanta Luisa Fernanda of Spain
data.text:
Infanta Luisa Fernanda of Spain (María Luisa Fernanda; 30 January 1832 – 2 February 1897) was an Infanta of Spain by birth and the Duchess of Montpensier after her 1846 marriage to a son of King Louis Philippe I of the French. Her husband was Prince Antoine of Orléans, Duke of Montpensier. She was also a sister of Queen Isabel II of Spain.

Marriage[edit]

In the Royal Palace of Madrid, on 10 October 1846 she the Infanta married Prince Antoine of Orléans, Duke of Montpensier, a son King Louis Philippe I of the French.

Issue[edit]

Princess Marie Isabelle of Orléans (21 September 1848 – 23 April 1919) married Prince Philippe, Count of Paris an had children.

Princess Maria Amelia of Orléans (1851 – 1870) never married.

Princess María Cristina of Orléans (29 October 1852 – 28 April 1879) never married.

Princess Maria de la Regla of Orléans (1856–1861)

[?] (1857-1857)

Prince Fernando of Orléans (1859–1873)

Mercedes of Orléans (24 June 1860 – 26 June 1878) married Alfonso XII of Spain but had no issue.

Infante Antonio, Duke of Galliera (23 February 1866 – 24 December 1930) married Infanta Eulalia of Spain and had issue.

Titles and styles[edit]

30 January 1832 – 10 October 1846 Her Royal Highness Infanta Doña Luisa Fernanda of Spain.

10 October 1846 – 4 February 1890 Her Royal Highness The Duchess of Montpensier.

4 February 1890 – 2 February 1897 Her Royal Highness The Dowager Duchess of Montpensier.

Honours[edit]
